article.head: Climate Action Note – Climate Action progress

text.p: Global temperatures are linked to the concentration of greenhouse gases (GHG) in our atmosphere and we are heading for a catastrophic rise in excess of 3°C this century. To limit this to 1.5°C, we need to cut emissions by 30 gigatones annually by 2030. That means cutting emissions from transport and industry, managing land and resources more efficiently, building smart cities and curbing deforestation and food waste. The world has to move towards net-zero emissions soon - and start moving now.
The UNEP Climate ActionDashboard shows you the global state of climate action and where each country has work to do.

article.title: Emissions
article.head: GHG emissions are choking our world and changing our climate

text.p: Net-zero target emissions cartogram by GHG emissions colored by NZT status
Tilegram showing trend colored by NZT status

Global temperatures are linked to the concentration of greenhouse gases (GHG) in our atmosphere and we are heading for a catastrophic rise in excess of 3°C this century. To limit this to 1.5°C, we need to cut emissions by 30 gigatones annually by 2030. The Emissions Gap Report 2021 concludes that the commitments made in NDCs will lead to a 2.7°C warmer world beyond the Paris Agreement promises - and only if they are followed by adequate and acute action.

There is popular support for such emission reductions and to act ambitiously and adequately on the climate emergency.
Data for PM2.5 exposure and attributable deaths comes from Health Effects Institute. 2020. State of Global Air 2020. Data source: Global Burden of Disease Study 2019. IHME, 2020.

Data for sectors breakdown comes from McDuffie, E.E., Martin, R.V., Spadaro, J.V. et al. Source sector and fuel contributions to ambient PM2.5 and attributable mortality across multiple spatial scales. Nat Commun 12, 3594 (2021)
The data for the sector section was reaggregated from country data into UNEP regions, which are different from the ones used in the study.
Data for policy implementations comes from Actions on Air Quality: A Global Summary of Policies and Programmes to Reduce Air Pollution. UNEP, 2021.
